com.samysadi.acs.core.event

Class EventChain

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samysadi.acs.core.event.EventImpl
      • com.samysadi.acs.core.event.EventChain
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Event, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DispensableEventChain

    public abstract class EventChain
extends EventImpl
    This class extends the Event class and can be used if you want to schedule multiple events at a given moment of the simulation, and make sure that each event is processed before the next event is scheduled.

    More precisely after scheduling this event, the processStage(int) method is scheduled and called repetitively as long as it returns CONTINUE.
    At the first call, the processStage(int) method is called with the 0 parameter using current event. Then, if that method returns CONTINUE, this event is cloned and scheduled to run at the same simulation time, but with a 1 parameter. The parameter keeps incrementing and the method is re-called as long as it returns the CONTINUE value.

    This class is particularly useful if you need to call multiple Entity's methods in a sequential order, and make sure the generated notifications when calling each of these methods will be processed before the next method is run.

    Since:
    1.0

      abstract boolean processStage(int stageNum)
      This method is repetitively called with an incremented stageNum, starting from 0, as long as it returns true.

      • clone

        public EventChain clone()
        Specified by:
        clone in interface Event
        Overrides:
        clone in class EventImpl

      • processStage

        public abstract boolean processStage(int stageNum)
        This method is repetitively called with an incremented stageNum, starting from 0, as long as it returns true.
        This is done by transparently scheduling a clone of this event after each stage.

        Note make sure that this method can return false or the simulator will be stuck in a dead loop.

        Parameters:
        stageNum -
        Returns:
        CONTINUE if this event has to be re-scheduled and this method recalled. STOP otherwise.

      • process

        public final void process()
        Description copied from interface: Event
        This method is called by the simulator when the time has come to process this event.
